name: Chorizo Filled Dates
author: ginavee
summary: A fantastic flavor of smoky (the bacon), spicy (the chorizo), and the sweetness of dates.  My family are not big dried fruit fans, but everyone loved this!
directions: Cut the ends off of the chorizo, and cut into 12 cubes
Stuff each piece inside one of the dates
Wrap a piece of bacon around each date, and secure with toothpicks
This part may all be done ahead of time
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat
Place the dates in the pan with the bacon seam side down
Fry until golden, then turn and fry on the other side until bacon is cooked through
You may serve them now, or proceed to coat and fry them
Heat the oil in a deep-fryer or large skillet to 375 degrees F 190 degrees C
Whisk together the egg and water in a small bowl
Coat the dates with flour, then dip into the egg
Place immediately into the hot oil, and fry until golden, turning once
This will take about 4 minutes total
